head.title: What Is Needed to Conquer AIDS?

hedline.hl1: What Is Needed to Conquer AIDS?

abstract.p: Caroline Redding letter says that as delegate to international AIDS conference in South Africa she finds it appalling and offensive that Pres Thabo Mbeki questions established premise that HIV causes AIDS and fails to take leadership role (S)

block.p: As a delegate to the 13th International AIDS Conference in Durban, South Africa, I am appalled at President Thabo Mbeki's questioning of the idea that H.I.V. causes AIDS (editorial, July 12), an established scientific premise. It is offensive that the president of the most influential country in Africa has not taken a leadership role on this issue.

As a delegate to the 13th International AIDS Conference in Durban, South Africa, I am appalled at President Thabo Mbeki's questioning of the idea that H.I.V. causes AIDS (editorial, July 12), an established scientific premise. It is offensive that the president of the most influential country in Africa has not taken a leadership role on this issue.

If Mr. Mbeki is concerned that his government cannot afford to subsidize anti-retroviral drugs, then he should at least start a prevention program to slow the rate of H.I.V. infection. By bringing this conference back to square one, he undermines the personal struggles of men, women and children living with H.I.V. and AIDS.
CAROLINE REDDING Durban, South Africa, July 12, 2000
